elements.MAIN_EFFECT: Roba #tres cartas#.

loreEntryElements.text: «Permíteme que te acompañe a la puerta».

Taru wraps his sticky legs around the monster's head and prevents it from seeing. He struggles to maintain his grip as his suckers stick and unstick repeatedly. I just need a few more seconds... The nightmarish Chimaera gnashes its teeth and manages to bite one of my Alter Ego's limbs. I gasp in pain as I feel Taru's tentacle sever. It will grow back, of course, but my stomach churns as I feel my companion's distress. That spurs my anger to take over. I trace Signs in the air to slow down time. A few stolen moments will help me banish the Tumult's aberration. That's the idea, at least. Around me, space-time glimmers like a mirror as everything plays out in slow motion. Movements and sounds. Taru squealing. The Chimaera snorting wildly. The grass slowly waving...

I summon the portal, which expands in reality like a disk bordered with purple lightning. From the other side of the tear, I can feel the pressure of the Tumult's currents, clamoring to rush through. But I won't let them. I draw a figure in the air and teleport Taru behind me, then perform a complex kata to propel the aberration through the opening. Time is starting to return to normal speed. It accelerates, freeing itself from its shackles. I strike the air with the flat of my hand to send a gust towards the Chimaera. I see the point of impact and violence of the shock, even though everything is still moving in slow motion, like wading through oil. I finally release my stranglehold on time as the creature is catapulted backwards from the explosion. I close the portal as quickly as I can, then fall to my knees, completely exhausted.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: [[Fugacidad]]. (Una vez resuelto mi efecto, envíame a la pila de descartes en lugar de a la reserva.)  Descarta un personaje o permanente objetivo.

loreEntryElements.text: «Permíteme que te acompañe a la puerta».

Taru wraps his sticky legs around the monster's head and prevents it from seeing. He struggles to maintain his grip as his suckers stick and unstick repeatedly. I just need a few more seconds... The nightmarish Chimaera gnashes its teeth and manages to bite one of my Alter Ego's limbs. I gasp in pain as I feel Taru's tentacle sever. It will grow back, of course, but my stomach churns as I feel my companion's distress. That spurs my anger to take over. I trace Signs in the air to slow down time. A few stolen moments will help me banish the Tumult's aberration. That's the idea, at least. Around me, space-time glimmers like a mirror as everything plays out in slow motion. Movements and sounds. Taru squealing. The Chimaera snorting wildly. The grass slowly waving...

I summon the portal, which expands in reality like a disk bordered with purple lightning. From the other side of the tear, I can feel the pressure of the Tumult's currents, clamoring to rush through. But I won't let them. I draw a figure in the air and teleport Taru behind me, then perform a complex kata to propel the aberration through the opening. Time is starting to return to normal speed. It accelerates, freeing itself from its shackles. I strike the air with the flat of my hand to send a gust towards the Chimaera. I see the point of impact and violence of the shock, even though everything is still moving in slow motion, like wading through oil. I finally release my stranglehold on time as the creature is catapulted backwards from the explosion. I close the portal as quickly as I can, then fall to my knees, completely exhausted.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: Descarta un personaje o permanente objetivo.

loreEntryElements.text: Un viaje de mil leguas comienza con un solo paso.

Senka wraps its night feathers around me, and we leap through the raging vortex. The fabric of space bends, and time stops mid-flight. I hurtle down for miles, vast panoramas stretching out as I pass. The world is a wave, a roll that spirals on forever. We ride it like a seething river. Forests, plains and massifs expand and contract in a frenzied dance. And as we emerge from the whirlwind, a thousand cable lengths from our starting point, all my Sigils pulse around me, creating a barrier that I hope is unbreachable. I rush forward, then perform a roll to get myself back on guard. Not to be outdone, my Chimaera spreads its wings to give me cover as I try to take stock of my new environment. It's an estuary, with water flowing into a bay at the mercy of the falling tide...

But no matter which way I turn, there's no sign of the Chrysanthemum Cloak Warlock. He seems to have vanished. So I take a few steps towards the lifeless body sprawled several feet away from me, walking carefully to avoid any traps. But nothing leaps out in my direction, and no sudden spikes appear at my feet. I kneel down next to Qaasin, placing a couple of fingers on his throat to check his pulse. I push back the tears. His skin is cold and pale. Turning away from the body of my mentor, I roar and release all the spells I've been keeping in reserve, blasting the land around me. I smash a stone mound and scorch the sand with fire until it turns into a frozen wave of glass. I scream out all my rage, my pain, my despair... He warned me. He told me that if I continued to hunt him, he would need to take measures...

cardRulings.question: What happens if "Small Step, Giant Leap" is played during the tiebreaker?
cardRulings.answer: In the Arena, Expeditions can't move forward nor backwards since there's only one Region. Any such effect becomes irrelevant.

cardRulings.question: If I play "Small Step, Giant Leap" while my Expeditions are adjacent, do I win immediately?
cardRulings.answer: As soon as the effect has fully resolved, yes.

cardRulings.question: Can "Celebration Day" stop "Small Step, Giant Leap"?
cardRulings.answer: Yes. In general, if an effect tells you to do something and another tells you that you cannot, the negative effect wins. Celebration Day prevents your Expedition from moving forward during the Day. If Small Step, Giant Leap is played on that Expedition during that Day, it will have no effect.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: [[Fugacidad]]. (Una vez resuelto mi efecto, envíame a la pila de descartes en lugar de a la reserva.)  Una expedición objetivo avanza una región.

loreEntryElements.text: Las olas aplastaron con fuerza al ejército en mitad de su carga, y un sinnúmero de soldados se perdieron en las profundidades del mar embravecido.

I watch with horror as the soldiers of the Aegis are swallowed by the waves. The Kraken ravages the Ordis ranks, and I'm desperate to join in and help them. But Taru is clinging to my arm and he turns to me with tearful eyes. With one of his tentacles, he points to the other side of the battlefield. But I can't understand the words he speaks to me. "Elsewhere. The threat is coming from elsewhere." His suckers adhere to my skin, preventing me from incanting. I see a figure disappear in the swell and beg my Alter Ego to let go of me. He finally relents, pouting sullenly as his legs release their grip and hang limply. Down below, the sea is pure chaos. The foam boils, the swells crash into the cliffs, and the water spirals like an emptying bathtub. But that's where I must go.

I let myself fall and dive beneath the surface. I immediately feel the currents tugging at me, but I manage to hold my breath. I let myself be dragged to the depths, to the fathomless darkness of the sea bed. Holding my breath, I use a combination of gestures to summon a portal to dry land. I feel the currents changing direction as the swirling water is sucked into the portal I've half-opened along with the soldiers who have been swallowed by the waves. I need to keep it open. I must keep it open so they can pass through. The pressure on my lungs becomes increasingly unbearable, and black spots dance on the edge of my vision. But I can't give up yet. Taru suddenly wraps himself around my head and releases an air bubble into the cavity he's created with his gelatinous body. I take in a big gulp of air and cough to spit out the water I've swallowed through my nose.

cardRulings.question: What happens if I use Kraken's Wrath against Characters with Tough?
cardRulings.answer: You pay extra mana for each Character with Tough.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: [[Fugacidad]]. (Una vez resuelto mi efecto, envíame a la pila de descartes en lugar de a la reserva.)  Envía a la reserva hasta tres personajes objetivo con coste desde la mano total de {5} o menos.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: [[Fugacidad]]. (Una vez resuelto mi efecto, envíame a la pila de descartes en lugar de a la reserva.)  Envía a la reserva hasta #cuatro# personajes objetivo con coste desde la mano total de #{6} o menos#.

loreEntryElements.text: El cielo se abrió con un estruendo cuando el sueño se liberó sobre el mundo.

Taru is sleeping peacefully on my chest. But I can't seem to fall asleep. I think of Kumari and how far apart we are. I remember the chaos of the battlefield as I listen to the shrill song of the cicadas. I think back to the raging water and roaring fire as I contemplate the pricks of light that dot the heavens. I recall what Afanas and Senka did during the battle against the Kraken. Even though it ultimately failed, the Battlemage had made fire rain down from the sky. I didn't have much time to study astronomy back when I was a student in the Kadigir. I had lots of other things to worry about. But I still knew the basics. Up there, in the vast sky, there were other fiery balls, other stars like the Sun...

There were also other worlds, maybe inhabited by amazing creatures like in some of the old books. Maybe Taru and the other Chimaeras came from there... Taru instinctively wraps a tentacle around one of my fingers, probably because he sensed I was thinking of him. I sigh as I look up to the night sky again. If there were people like us who lived on other planets – or even on the moon – did they also experience the Confluence? Do they also watch the dark sky like we do with our telescopes? Could they help us? I would have loved to learn the names of the stars and constellations, but I hadn't had enough time. Senka had gone to find one and send it crashing down to Earth. Well, the idea of a star at least. But down here, who really knows what goes on up there, far above the clouds?

cardRulings.question: What happens if I use Celestial Blast against Tough Characters or Permanent?
cardRulings.answer: You pay extra mana for each Tough target.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: [[Fugacidad]]. (Una vez resuelto mi efecto, envíame a la pila de descartes en lugar de a la reserva.)  Descarta hasta dos objetivos, personajes o permanentes.

loreEntryElements.text: Hay quienes la llaman «patapollo», en parte por su choza.

I make my way over to the raised front steps of the isba, following the long ribbed legs the cabin is perched on. I could see from afar that Baba Yaga was at home, as there was a plume of smoke coming from the chimney. But I'm still surprised when I open the front door. Facing me, comfortably seated in an armchair, is a Muna drinking a cup of tea, while the witch is in the kitchen preparing what looks like – or rather smells like – a borscht. The Muna beckons me to sit down opposite her. She is sitting cross-legged, one foot dangling casually as she sips at her concoction. I remember her name: Saskia, if I'm not mistaken. It's not unusual for Muna to seek out Baba Yaga. The Eidolon was also responsible for watching over the expanses of forest...

Yet there's something a little off about the look on the young Muna's face. I can sense danger, even though there's nothing in the room to suggest it. The lace doilies, the dried flowers hanging from the rafters, the kitchen utensils neatly arranged above the wood stove... Everything has an old-fashioned, almost rustic charm, but nothing that would suggest any sort of threat. Except Baba Yaga, of course. So that means it's the Muna's presence that I find unsettling. I sit down on a chair, pushing aside the tartan covering it. Saskia gets up and places a porcelain plate next to me with some sugar-crusted pryaniki on it. The hut's wooden frame creaks with each movement of the isba. Nothing seems out of the ordinary. But beneath the smell of cumin, nutmeg and star anise, and behind the other guest's fixed smile, something sinister is brewing...

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: {J} Roba una carta.  {T}, sacrificar un personaje: [Después de ti]. (Termina tu turno como si hubieras jugado una carta. A lo largo del día actual, puedes jugar más cartas.)

loreEntryElements.text: No es una simple fruslería, es un fragmento de sueño puro.

It's now Matera's turn to come forward. Her shoulders are tense and her steps hesitant as she collects her hammer and chisel from Flamel. She gives me a discreet glance, and I nod to reassure her. She sighs and takes a few steps towards the Megalith, which pulses with an amethyst glow. After this ceremony, she'll officially be an Yzmir Initiate. After this formality, she'll be my equal. I watch her hold her breath. In front of her, the meteor of Aether throbs intimidatingly in the gloom. She places the point of her chisel on its surface, taking care to target a little lump. Then she takes a long breath to calm her nerves, raises her arm... and strikes with the hammer. The metallic clink resounds around the vast chasm and reverberates in a thousand echoes. The fragment that was cut from the Megalith falls to the ground, and she bends over to pick it up.

This tear-shaped stone will help her channel her magic more effectively. But suddenly, I see her hesitate. Next to her, the Megalith has started to tremble and pulsate furiously. Matera quickly grabs the shard, then takes a few steps back. She jumps when Flamel places a hand on her shoulder, but quickly realizes he's just moving her aside to give me the room I need. The trembling has become a rumbling. But I'm ready. I immediately place a statuette on the ground to summon one of the guardians of the Well of Tears. Matera watches me, hugging her fragment to her chest. The Disciples and newly inducted Initiates step back and begin to utter incantations to help me. The shards of the Megalith glow in the darkness, while iridescent emanations begin to dance in the air.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: Al mediodía — Roba una carta.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: #{J} Roba una carta.#  Al mediodía — Roba una carta.

loreEntryElements.text: ¿Qué secretos siniestros se esconden en el Colegio de magia de Asgartha? Tan solo los dementes y los de Yzmir lo saben con seguridad...

I tug Kumari by the sleeve, and we hide in the bushes. I place a finger on my lips to tell my sister to stay quiet and not move. It would really suck if any students – or worse, teachers – found us just as we arrived. We watch them pass as they head towards a weird-looking building. They're wearing long hooded gowns and carrying around large books that are no doubt full of strange symbols. Once they're a reasonable distance away, I signal to Kumari to follow me. There's a grove I want to visit today, and from what I saw last time, it should be a really cool place to play. So, we go around the greenhouse where lots of strange plants and trees are growing, and we hide from the brightly colored birds taking flight to be sure they won't rat us out.

Luckily, the Kadigir is a maze of paths, tree plantations, gardens, hills and shady undergrowth. As long as we don't get too close to the large buildings and we stay in the park, there's a good chance no one will spot us. And we don't want to get caught because, last time, the Magister had been within an inch of turning us in to mom and pop. We avoid the menagerie because Kumari is scared of the strange animals that lurk in there. We go through the orchards to swipe some of the exotic fruit that has all those unusual flavors. And then we finally arrive at our destination. It's a small courtyard sometimes used for meditation, but most of the time it's completely empty. I take off my sandals and plunge my feet into the fountain where fat purple flamingos are babbling. I cup a bit of water in my hands and throw it up into the air. It transforms into a bubble that starts to float towards the Magisterium...

cardRulings.question: What happens if I use the Kadigir to cast a Spell such as Off You Go! or Kraken's Wrath on a Tough target?
cardRulings.answer: You cast it for free!

cardRulings.question: What happens I play a card for free with The Kadigir, Yzmir Bastion, while my opponent controls a card that increases the cost of my Spells, such as the Rare version of Robin Hood?
cardRulings.answer: A free card remains free!  Playing a card for free means bypassing its cost entirely, which is different from reducing it to zero.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: {T}: El siguiente hechizo que juegues este turno es sin coste.

loreEntryElements.text: Siempre con hambre de nuevas ideas...

Hunger... It's always there, like a void that seeks only to devour everything. I can only sate it for a while, but it always comes back, demanding its due, growling for a new offering. It's there, like a bottomless pit. It's there, like a master that can never be satisfied. Hunger... I know that nothing – no sacrifice, no libation – can make it feel any sense of satisfaction. It's there, like an open maw with sharp fangs. It's there, with the ultimate goal of gobbling up everything. Because it knows that there's a meal here much more nourishing than a mere series of ideas. It devours. It gnashes. It salivates at the idea of its next feast...

cardRulings.question: What happens if Maw leaves the Expedition zone?
cardRulings.answer: It's removed from the game, like any other token.

cardRulings.question: If I sacrifice two Characters simultaneously, for example with the Kraken, what happens to Maw?
cardRulings.answer: Maw gains 4 Boosts.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: Cuando sacrifiques un personaje — Gano 2 potenciadores.

loreEntryElements.text: El maná es el vínculo que une las ideas y la realidad.

I watch the funeral procession as it slowly makes its way to the Asphodel cemetery. I don't want to join them. I prefer to give Matera's family some space so they can grieve in private. I notice the stooped silhouettes of her parents, wrapping their arms around her little brother as best they can. Unable to hold back his tears, he had been sobbing inconsolably throughout the ceremony. I sigh and turn my gaze towards the turquoise and icy water of the fjord. But I quickly turn away. Staring at the water for too long brings back bitter memories of her death... I suddenly feel all the hairs on my body stand on end. I turn around and see the Eidolon of Wanjiru quietly sitting on a headstone, staring at me. He greets me and beckons me to come closer, which I decide to do after hesitating briefly. Cold sweat covers my entire body.

"My condolences for your Disciple, Initiate," he says. "And congratulations on defeating the Kraken." My eyes narrow, not knowing why the founder of the Qorgan is interested in me. Have I violated a Mandate? Wanjiru simply smiles. "I know the timing is bad, but there's no room for complacency when the safety of Asgartha is at stake. I know that the Kraken was defeated in a unique way by a young Bravos. But even though I think his intentions were commendable, his methods grabbed my attention, to say the least. Few can claim to conjure Mana in such a... voracious manner." Kojo had indeed managed to absorb incredible amounts of Mana, much more than Alterers would usually collect. "That's why I need you, Afanas. It would be a shame if certain secrets were to get out..."

cardRulings.question: Can I choose Mana Convergence if an effect asks me to discard a card or to put it in Reserve?
cardRulings.answer: Yes.

cardRulings.question: What happens if a Mana Convergence somehow ends up in Reserve?
cardRulings.answer: Nothing special. It cannot be played, but can still be discarded during Clean-Up or through another effect.

elements.MAIN_EFFECT: No se me puede jugar, pero se me puede usar como orbe de maná. (En un draft, puedes añadir cualquier número de cartas "Convergencia de maná" a tu mazo.)
